definition: to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Remember that God sets us to our (His) tasks, and we dare not presume to arrogate any tasks to ourselves apart from Him.
sentences.chinese: 記住是神給我們分配任務，我們怎敢離開神自立門戶。

sentences.english: Projects which create forks should be thinking about merging back from the outset.
sentences.chinese: 自立門戶的項目也應該想着要合併回去。

sentences.english: One of the big assumptions brought into this debate is that forking is a bad thing.
sentences.chinese: 這場討論的一個重大假設是，自立門戶是一件壞事。

sentences.english: He encouraged his apprentices to set themselves up in business, and a culture of watchmaking developed.
sentences.chinese: 他鼓勵他的學徒自立門戶，從而發展出製表文化。

sentences.english: Projects which create forks also need to think about their processes.
sentences.chinese: 自立門戶的項目也需要思考他們的流程。

definition: startup (company, phase etc)/newly established/in the early stages
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
League of Nations (1920-1946), based in Geneva, precursor of the UN
to make one's mark/to go up in the world/to make one's fortune
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
